title: Etisalat (telecom operator) soft sans logo
content:
I am trying to ID the font being used in this logo, [http://img157.imageshack.us/img157/2425/font7ll.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011305/http:/img157.imageshack.us/img157/2425/font7ll.jpg "http://img157.imageshack.us/img157/2425/font7ll.jpg")

It belongs to a telecom operator in the UAE [[www.etisalat.ae](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011305/http:/www.etisalat.ae/ "www.etisalat.ae") ]

Its not one of the standard MS Office fonts so am a bit lost. Any suggestions would be appreciated. Thank you in advance.

PS-after reading all,(most of), the posts in the "Type ID Board" am sure that if any one can help, you guys can.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011305/http:/typophile.com/files/font_40.jpg) | 4.77 KB |
author: bob1234

comments.content: If no one responds with the exact font you are looking for -- and you would like a very close substitute - take a look at ITC Benguiat Gothic Medium... The "e" is different, but it is the same overall feeling...

As they're using [Neo Tech Alternate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011305/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=24&displayfontid=C.117387.0.0&fontRendererText=Welcome+to+Etisalat) as their corporate typeface and not the logo font, I suspect it probably is custom designed.

[ITC Benguiat Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011305/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=18&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=benguiat+gothic&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=etisalat) is a very sound advice for an alternative.
